title: الْفِعْلُ الْمَزِيد - بَاب فَعَّلَ
description: Learn Form II verbs with doubled middle letter: عَلَّمَ (to teach), كَسَّرَ (to shatter), فَرَّحَ (to make happy).

notes.title: The Letter Wāw (و)
content: The letter wāw has multiple uses in Arabic. It can be a letter within a word, a conjunction meaning 'and', a preposition for oaths meaning 'by', or wāw al-ḥāl prefixed to a nominal sentence describing circumstances.
keyPoints: As conjunction (حرف العطف): خرج الزبير وحامد (Zubair and Hamid went out)
As oath preposition: واللهِ ما رأيته (By Allah, I did not see him)
As wāw al-ḥāl: دخلت المسجد والإمام يركع (I entered the mosque while the imam was bowing)

examples.english: I entered the mosque while the imam was bowing

notes.title: Form II Verbs (فَعَّلَ)
content: Form II verbs are formed by doubling the middle radical of a triliteral verb. This pattern often indicates intensive or causative action - making someone do something or doing something extensively.
keyPoints: Pattern: فَعَّلَ (fa''ala) with doubled middle letter
Often causative: عَلِمَ (to know) → عَلَّمَ (to teach/make know)
Can be intensive: كَسَرَ (to break) → كَسَّرَ (to shatter/break into pieces)

exercises.promptEn: The mother made her son happy

exercises.prompt: The teacher taught the students Arabic in the classroom
exercises.answer: عَلَّمَ الْمُدَرِّسُ الطُّلَّابَ الْعَرَبِيَّةَ فِي الْفَصْلِ

exercises.prompt: She cleaned the room before the guests arrived
